text:
<@U01QVR44MEY> is there a way to store JSON type data in a good format as a deal/contact property?
saving after JSON.stringfy() is not readable
What do you mean it isn't readable?
You just need to JSON.parse() it once you try and use it
`readable` was a wrong term. thanks
I don't think you can use localhost (and even if you could I think you would need to set the port) with workflows, you could setup a ngrok tunnel that would expose the server so you can test
You're good, I thought you might have meant like for people trying to read the property from the CRM page
hi! is there any way to integrate otp with HubSpot membership?
Currently no
I would love that functionality though
I just made this post in the HubSpot Idea's form yesterday
<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/Passkey-Login-For-HubSpot-App-and-Membership-Pages/idi-p/710161#M126349>
Thank u carter
For sure
Hey all is there a way to create a list of contacts that are assigned to deactivated contact owners?
Sharing this here as well as I dont see a HubDB channel
Hi. Is it possible that Smart Rules within the CMS can not be applied on whole sections?
<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C019VT42R8X/p1666797735112669>

*HubSpot Salesforce Integration question*
------------------------------------------------------
Our team is using HubSpot and Salesforce integration and facing some issues with notes/meetings sync.

The system is throwing *object sync error(under Picklist errors)* asking us to reactivate the user on Salesforce or transfer the ownership.

This isn't possible since note's ownership can't be transferred nor we can reactive the user again.
The contact record is syncing  only the notes have this issue.

Has anyone come across this issue? Any recommended solutions to try.

Thanks <@U01QVR44MEY>! Your advice was much appreciated as I used an ngrok tunnel to expose the server for testing.
of course, let me know if you run into any more issues
